site.name: Meristem

hero.headline: AI tools that require human approval.
hero.subheadline: Deterministic AI tools for teams that need control, auditability, and zero surprises.

whatIs.heading: What is Meristem
whatIs.paragraph: Meristem is not a single product. It is a company that builds deterministic, ledger-first software tools — each designed so that AI assists but never decides. Every Meristem product records every action in an append-only ledger, requires human approval before execution, and produces outputs that can be replayed and verified.

0.title: One company, multiple products.
0.text: Meristem Lens is the first. Others follow the same principles.

1.title: Ledger-native.
1.text: Every action, proposal, and decision is recorded. Nothing is deleted. Everything is auditable.

2.title: Human authority is architectural, not optional.
2.text: No Meristem product can take irreversible action without explicit human approval. This is enforced by design, not by policy.

3.title: Deterministic by default.
3.text: Given the same inputs and ledger state, every Meristem product produces the same output. Reproducibility is a requirement, not a feature.

whyExists.heading: The problem with AI you can’t audit

paragraphs.0: Most AI-powered tools operate as black boxes. They make decisions you can’t trace, take actions you can’t reproduce, and change behavior in ways you can’t explain. For teams in regulated industries, security-sensitive environments, or any organization that needs to answer “why did this happen?” — that’s not acceptable.
paragraphs.1: Meristem exists because we believe AI tools should be:

0.title: Explainable.
0.text: If a tool can’t show its reasoning in plain text, it shouldn’t be making decisions.

1.title: Reproducible.
1.text: Run the same analysis twice, get the same result. No hidden state, no model drift, no surprises.

2.title: Controllable.
2.text: The human approves. The tool executes. Not the other way around.

3.title: Auditable.
3.text: Every action is recorded in an append-only ledger with timestamps, actors, and checksums. If an auditor asks what happened, the ledger answers.

whyExists.closing: We don’t build AI that replaces judgment. We build AI that supports it — visibly, traceably, and under your control.

0.title: Determinism
0.description: Same inputs, same outputs. Every time. No hidden state, no model drift, no probabilistic surprises.

1.title: Ledger-first
1.description: Every action is recorded in an append-only ledger. Entries are timestamped, hash-chained, and never deleted. The ledger is the source of truth.

2.title: Human-in-the-loop
2.description: AI proposes. Humans approve. No Meristem product takes irreversible action without explicit human authorization.

3.title: Read-only before action
3.description: Meristem tools observe and analyze first. Anything that modifies state requires a separate, auditable approval step.

4.title: Reproducibility
4.description: Every analysis can be replayed from the ledger. If an auditor, regulator, or team lead asks “what happened?” — the answer is in the record.

productLens.heading: Meristem Lens
productLens.description: Meristem Lens scans your codebase for dependency vulnerabilities and exposed secrets. Every scan is initiated by you — manually or on your schedule. Every finding is recorded in an append-only audit ledger. Nothing runs autonomously.

capabilities.2: Scan dashboard with findings, runs, and trends
capabilities.3: Append-only audit ledger with full traceability
capabilities.4: Integration with Azure DevOps and GitHub

productLens.doesNotHeading: What Meristem Lens does not do

0.title: Does not execute code in your environment.
0.text: Lens uses a device-based scanning protocol. Your code is analyzed locally. No cloud execution.

1.title: Does not make decisions.
1.text: Findings are presented. Humans prioritize and act.

2.title: Does not run autonomously.
2.text: Every scan requires initiation. No background processes, no silent monitoring.

3.title: Does not store your source code.
3.text: Scans produce findings and metadata. Your code stays where it is.

4.title: Does not self-trigger actions based on model output.
4.text: No thresholds, no background agents, no autonomous escalation.

productLens.safe: Lens was built for teams that have rejected other tools because they couldn’t explain what happens to their code. Every Lens operation is logged, reproducible, and auditable. There is no autonomous behavior. There is no black box.

trust.heading: Built for teams that answer to auditors
trust.intro: Meristem products are designed for environments where “trust me” is not an acceptable answer.

auditability.title: Auditability
auditability.text: Every action produces a ledger entry with: timestamp, actor, action type, inputs, outputs, and a SHA-256 checksum. The ledger is append-only. Entries cannot be modified or deleted. Any historical state can be reconstructed by replaying the ledger from the beginning.

bullets.0: Device-based scanning: your code never leaves your infrastructure
bullets.4: No telemetry that isn’t explicitly documented

compliance.title: Compliance readiness
compliance.text: Meristem’s ledger-first architecture produces audit trails that align with requirements from SOC 2, ISO 27001, and similar frameworks. We do not claim certification — we claim that our architecture makes certification easier because traceability is built in, not bolted on.

noLockin.title: No vendor lock-in
noLockin.text: Ledger data is stored in NDJSON — a plain-text, human-readable format. You can read, export, and process your audit trail with any tool. If you stop using Meristem, your data is yours, in a format you can open with a text editor.

description.title: Description of Service
description.text: Meristem Lens is a code analysis tool that scans codebases for dependency vulnerabilities and exposed secrets. The Service operates through a device-based scanning protocol: your source code is analyzed locally on your infrastructure. Meristem does not execute code in your environment, does not store your source code, and does not take autonomous actions. Every scan requires explicit human initiation. Findings and metadata are recorded in an append-only audit ledger.
